meanings.definition: To offer or suggest additional products or services to a customer during a sales transaction.
meanings.sent1: The salesperson upsells the customer by recommending a better phone case.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to upsell customers on accessories like chargers.
meanings.sent3: The clever salesperson managed to upsell the customer on a second pair of shoes.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully upsells the idea of a larger size by highlighting its benefits.
meanings.sent5: The store manager trains the staff on how to effectively upsell to increase sales.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading a customer to purchase a more expensive item or upgrade.
meanings.sent1: The upsells at the electronics store often include extended warranties.
meanings.sent2: Customers sometimes appreciate the upsell to a premium membership for added benefits.
meanings.sent3: The upsells on the car lot made the customer consider a luxury model.
meanings.sent4: The upsell to a larger popcorn at the movies seemed like a good deal.
meanings.sent5: The upsells on the menu tempted the customer to try the deluxe dessert.
